name: pushinIcon
label: PushIn.js
heading: PushIn.js
copy: I built PushIn.js as a lightweight opensource parallax effect that simulates an interactive dolly-in or push-in animation on a webpage.

name: indeed
label: Indeed
heading: My role at Indeed
copy: I'm proud to work at Indeed as a Web Developer in Marketing Systems.

name: igNateplusplus
label: Instagram
heading: Instagram
copy: Follow me on instagram @nateplusplus for all my nerdy tech pics.

name: gold-sun
label: Gold Sun
heading: Gold Sun
copy:
I love watching herons perched at a nearby pond. They sit and wait until just before the sun sets, and then take off, soaring above the trees. I like to think they enjoy the sunsets.

Details
Watercolor with gold metallic paint
11in x 11in, hot press paper

name: garden-creature
label: Garden Creature
heading: Garden Creature
copy:
I was inspired by some cubist and futurist artwork that almost deconstructed figures into interesting patterns. I wanted to do that with an animal to sort of capture all their movements in an abstract way.

Details
Watercolor and ink on paper
8in x 10in

name: coqui-flamboyan
label: Coquí Flamboyán
heading: Coquí Flamboyán
copy:
This work was dedicated to my mother-in-law who lives in San Juan, Puerto Rico. I wanted to find a creative way to integrate two beloved symbols of the island into one. This features a coquí frog, intertwined with the flower of a Flamboyán.

Details
Watercolor and ink on paper
4in x 6in

name: owl-city
label: Owl City
heading: Owl City
copy:
This was an exploration of meshing nature with an urban scene in an abstract way. I had some fun with peppered tones in this piece.

Details
Watercolor and ink on paper
11in x 14in

name: summit
label: Summit
heading: Summit
copy:
This idea started with a series of little bookmarks, but after seeing how much I loved the finished product, I wanted to try it out in a larger format too.

Details
Watercolor on paper
Three parts - 4.75in x 11in each

name: thunder
label: Thunder
heading: Thunder
copy:
I thought a lot about this one: how to paint a sound? I decided to try to convey a violent and noisy collision.

Details
Watercolor and white ink on paper
14in x 11in

name: treasure
label: Treasure
heading: Treasure
copy:
I had a lot of fun allowing the watercolors to mix freely and form interesting patterns like crystals forming on the page.

Details
Watercolor on paper
16.25in x 11.5in

name: casa
label: Casa
heading: Casa
copy:
My inspiration for this comes from looking at all the architectural shapes I've found around many neighborhoods here in Texas. When I chose this palette, I felt like it reminded me of a beach kiosk.

Details
Watercolor on paper
14in x 11in

name: tulip
label: Tulip
heading: Tulip
copy:
In this work I wanted to convey the concept of a Tulip using a minimalist style. I decided to add detail within the tones of each shape by scratching in textures with a palette knife and using a wet brush to create subtle bloom effects.

Details
Watercolor on paper
10.5in x 14.75in

name: treehouse
label: Treehouse
heading: Treehouse
copy:
This painting was sort of an experiment to see if I could convey the concept of a house purely through negative space. I liked the idea of nature really owning the space, and the home sort of melting into the background of that scene.

Details
Watercolor on paper
10in x 8in

name: gold
label: Golden Willow
heading: Golden Willow
copy:
I like to imagine being showered with gold when I look back at this work. The mix of textures made this painting a fun exercise, and I really enjoy the result.

Details
Watercolor on paper
8in x 10in
